resources.text:
The purpose of this application is to help you learn the basics of the Java programming language. This app, however, cannot do that alone. You will need to install Java on computer and practice actively while using this app.

This app is aimed towards those who never coded in their life. However, you're familiar with other languages, you'll also find it useful. If you already have experience with C++ or C# you'll learn fast and easily, as these languages are quite similar to Java.
To make development easier, using an <font color="#DF7401">Integrated Development Environment (IDE)</font> is recommended. These software provide code editors, build tools and various other tools.

boxed.title: Why should I use an IDE?

resources.boxed: Without an IDE, you must manually install the Java Development Kit (JDK) and use the command line to compile and run your code. The IDEs come with a built in JDK and running your entire project is as simple as pressing a button. The IDE also provides code completion and highlights errors in your code, making them easy to spot.
resources.text: Here are a few recommended IDEs for PCs and laptops:
resources.list:
• Eclipse: The most widely used Java IDE.
  • IntelliJ IDEA: A great IDE developed by JetBrains.
  • NetBeans: Another amazing IDE for Java development.
resources.text: While coding on your phone is much less convenient, there also exist Java IDEs for android. My recommendation is Java N-IDE, you can find it in the Google Play store here.
resources.advanced: If you for any reason can't or don't want to install any IDE, you can read about installing the JDK here, and about compiling and running your programs from the command line here.
resources.text:
This app splits the curriculum into courses, and within courses into chapters. Initially, only the first course is unlocked. You can unlock additional courses by reading through all the chapters and completing the related exam.

You may read through the chapters of a course in any order, but it's recommended that you follow the given order, as the chapters are built on each other. You will find a button at the bottom of every chapter. Press this to confirm that you understand its content and ready to move on the the next one.
resources.boxed: The chapters contain code samples. If the displayed code is wide enough, these are horizontally scrollable! You can also increase the code size, or copy their contents.
resources.text: Exams will try to measure how well you understood a course. This app obviously has no way to detect is you are using any outside help, but it's recommended that you do not.
resources.boxed:
You will have limited time to complete the exam. Additionally, if you fail an exam you must wait some time to start it again. After completing an exam, you may redo it anytime without having to wait.

The difficulty of the exams can be changed in the settings menu (top right corner).
resources.text:
You will also find tasks within each course. Tasks are projects that allow you to test your knowledge of the course by creating a full program.

As tasks are complex exercises with an almost infinite amount of possible solutions, your solution won't be checked by the app, and you may mark a task as completed at any time. One correct solution is however provided for each task, which you can use if you are stuck.

Tasks are optional (but recommended), the exam for a course will unlock even if you never opened any of its tasks. Unlike exams, you are free to check any chapters, or use other guides online for help when completing the task.
